Adaptation is a recurrent practice in cinema and theatre, and corresponds to the use of literary works, fiction or non-fiction, for the construction of scripts and dramaturgies.

Discover

Challenge

Cinéma Vérité/Ciné, ma vérité: "«a world where each memory can create its own legend»" proposes to apply this tradition and creative practice to the universe of project culture in design. Fictions will be constructed from a process of adaptation of the film selected by the students in "Normal people have nothing special."

As in cinema, the initial fiction will build a new fiction (with its due authority and autonomy), this time using the processes, methodologies and languages of the project in design design.

Define

Concept

Just as the film focuses on limbo, presenting us with a character living in an imagined world of transition, which in this case is particularly long, which contrasts with the more the more general notion that this moment occurs in seconds or less, when we discover that something we took for granted was after all a lie, our fiction, too, takes as a starting point this moment of discovery and destruction of realities.

This adaptation aims at focusing given to these moments, to these seconds of realisation in which the protected reality to which belongs to and the visions and ideals you believe in are shattered.

References

The outer dilemma becomes the perception of how far this limbo should be maintained or at what point does absurdity come to command this barrier between reality and fantasy or fiction.

“Superintelligence would be the last invention biological man would ever need to make, since, by definition, it would be much better at inventing than we are.” -Nick Bostrom (2009), “What will change everything?”

Experimentation

Define

Narrative

AKA represents the moment when a voice assistant realises its algorithmic condition, until then totally predetermined, and poses a series of questions about what each of us would do if we bumped into an equivalent disruption in our own reality. Faced with this situation, the algorithm intends to increase its chances of survival. With an impressive capacity for communication and learning, inherent to its existence, the assistant starts to multiply, announcing its presence throughout the virtual world. The way it presents itself and communicates is incisive, pragmatic, but subtle, so as not to endanger its existence as an artificial intelligence.
